ratings.comment:
Prof. Muniagurria truly has a passion for economics and tries to share it with her students.
Her notes are handwritten and I'd recommend you handwrite your class notes, too. This class is not really suitable for laptop notetaking, but I learned a lot this way. Attend regularly! Homework and exams are very fair.

Her lectures are incredibly boring and she is impressively slow. What she completes in a 75 minute lecture (in terms of notes), most students can complete in 10-15 minutes from her online notes, which I did once I stopped showing up after the second week. If you understand Econ well, problem sets and exams are not too difficult.

You'll probably get stuck taking this class - super boring and theory heavy, all lecture notes posted online so you don't have to go to class, but boy is it hard. Not particularly worse or better than any other Econ prof, but you'll need to be familiar with how to solve/derive models in a million different ways.

If you're an econ major you may be stuck taking 464. If possible, I would advise to find another professor. Her lectures make no sense and all of the notes are very scrambled. The tests are pretty identical to the homework, but make sure to actually understand the homework and not just memorize (she switches things).

Maria is one of the nicest professors I've had. The class is very theory heavy but it makes understanding the math really easy. I personally found her lecture's pretty interesting and she's made me love international trade. There are 3 exams, 6 homework assignments, and a trade report. If you understand the homework, the tests will be a breeze.

Lectures are a little disorganized, but the math is not difficult for this class. Problem sets (about 4 of them math-based and 1 about a reading) were fair and not hard. Exams were the same way. No final. 2 reports on trade disputes and then a group presentation.

Maria is truly a nice lady trying her best. However, she is not very clear and 464 is HEAVY on econ theory and not all of it is in the book. Her notes aren't great and lectures are dry, lots of problem sets. She is accommodating and will try to help you but if you are not good with math/graphs I would not recommend.

Professor Muniagurria covers really applicable material in 464. She does a good job focusing the course on specific models which at the end of the course is applied to the real world via a project/paper. This class made me seriously consider grad school in International Macroeconomics. I would highly recommend her class.

Maria is a very sweet lady who genuinely wants you to succeed. However, there is very little structure to the class and you really never see your grade. She handwrites all notes with no outline and rarely teaches to the book. One of the good things is that she does do a little bit of policy, but it is still mostly theory and graphs on tests.
She uses made up symbols in math problems. Go to class, sit on your phone for the attendance credit then read the book.
Maria goes through material very quickly, and her lectures tend to be quite dry.

Maria teaches this class in a way that you somehow end up learning virtually nothing in the course of a semester. The content is just the addition and substitution of different variables into the Solow Model. Her lectures are incredibly boring, as she makes you take notes the entire period with no pause for explanation. Would not recommend.

Shes nice enough, but I recommend you never take a class with her. I completed every test well above the class average and still got a B in the class. Her curve is ridiculously bad and she seems to not want students to succeed.

Maria really cares about students, and this shows in her willingness to answer questions and meet with students outside of class. Sometimes the course material can be difficult to follow, only because the class is notation heavy. Study hard in the beginning and the rest of the class will fall into place!

Maria is a caring and amazing professor. Her notes are by hang and not power point so it is way easier to see and follow her steps. Classes are a bit boring and no one shows up to them. Exams are easy.

She is a very caring person and you can learn a lot from her if you can communicate what you don't understand. Her accent and quiet voice make lectures difficult to follow but the notes are pretty straightforward and her tests are literally the lecture notes. Her practice tests are also very similar to the midterms/final.

Starts out disorganized, but afterwards comes together well. Maria cares, and does everything necessary to prepare everyone for exams--there's no reason you can't ace them with a reasonable amount of studying. There's one paper: lot of work, but interesting. You'll need to good at writing proofs (she'll help you learn). Overall good professor.

I loved Maria's Industrial Organization course! Although I did find it slightly challenging, the experience of learning from her was worth it. Her notes are written on paper, which may be hard to follow, but if you review them after class and organize them so they make sense to you they'll make a lot more sense. Exams were a little tough but fair.

Although her notes are sometimes a bit hard to read, lectures are generally easy to follow and she tries her best to include interesting stuff about development econ theory. Tests are hard if you don't have a solid understanding of calc, but all the derivations that you need for the test are in her lecture notes.

Her lectures were unclear sometimes, and her notes were not really useful. She usually referred to the texts from which the material came, which is where I learned most of the material. The two midterms were very similar to previous midterms; the final had a few curve balls but nothing terrifying. Overall a solid course and a solid instructor.

She is nice lady, but this class was not by any means easy. Fairly basic materials for an advanced level class yet exams are written so poorly that you have to have everything down to do well. As the semester progressed lectures seemed more and more pointless. All notes are posted online, and discussion is when you actually learn anything.
She WAS easy one in the past for 100% sure However, she changed her mind not to go easy way anymore.  Those who took it in Fall 2015 got bad luck. sad.
Econ 467 is one of the best econ class ever. Exams are super easy, but make sure you've done your readings and homeworks.
A great professor, explains everything you need to know and posts notes online. Had a great TA too. Easy curve too.

Probably my second favorite Econ professor. She was always prepared and you knew what you would be tested on for an exam. Pretty basic calc stuff and you def have a shot at getting an A w/all the extra credit. Took her for Econ 467
Best Econ Professor I have had. Class Is relatively easy if you have taken a few calculus classes. Some of my classmates struggled with that.
The best professor ever. Helpful and friendly. She is always there if you need help. Great professor.

Was a little difficult to figure out what to study from time to time. Maria is not an easy professor but overall not bad. No powerpoint slides but notes from class are scanned and put online. She knows what she's talking about but be prepared to figure things out outside of class.

Simply the best Economics teacher at UW.  She knows how to effectively and concisely explain all of the material.  If you go to lecture and study the slides/notes she post online then you will ace the exams.  I took her for 467 and thought she was such a good professor that I took another one of her classes the next semester.  I would recommend her
Spent a majority of the lectures deriving the economic models used.  Discussion sections were helpful to get extra practice.  Exams were challenging but fair.
Spent a majority of the lectures deriving the economic models used.  Discussion sections were helpful to get extra practice.  Exams were challenging but fair.

Terrible professor...punished our class for doing worse then her average class...news flash we should be competing with spring 2011 464 students not the fall 2009 class...incomprehensible and generally unhelpful...stay FAR away, Econ 522 is a much more useful class than this waste of time
Great professor, I have taken many classes with her, but this class was awful. Easy to get A or B. The material is not difficult but incredibly boring.  I really struggled maintaining interest
GO TO DISCUSSIONS>> very hard class..material is ok..would recommend taking another class

good professor.  go to lecture and discussion.  book supplements lecture but only focus on stuff covered in lecture.  if you go to class you will get a b or so.  if you study and read as well you can get an A.  a lot of the models taught are expressed graphically so if you struggle with understanding basic econ graphs i dont recommend this class

GO TO DISCUSSION!  this class was not too bad as long as you can derive complex equations.  i recommend attending lecture but the most important stuff is covered in discussion.  do not waste your time on all of the readings but make sure you read the HBS cases (only 3 or so all semester) she will ask exam questions on HBS cases!

I found this class relatively easy, but I can see how the way it is taught isn't helpful.  I actually stopped attending lecture and discussion, simply study the homework and look over the sample exam and you learn just as much.

her lectures are boring as hell but the materials are pretty easy. go to discussions since TA is a lot more helpful in understanding the materials than from the lectures. exams are a bit tricky but it's not impossible. the good part was that you don't need textbook for this class:)

Do not take her. The tests are on things that she often does not cover. She repeatedly says "you have to know how to do this, but I am just going to show you the result", leaving you to figure out what she is supposed to be teaching. Her readings are useless, and she is a poor enough lecture to make you fall asleep from boredom. Avoid at all costs.

Most awful economics class I've ever taken.  She fails over half of the class, her tests are super-math intensive and 1000x harder than the material she covers, AND she's extremely unhelpful.  Lectures are pretty useless because she's very hard to understand (not native english speaker). Nice lady, but don't take unless you want to wreck your GPA.

A bit difficult to detect which parts of lecture are useful/not at first. The class is very theory based, and her diagrams and comments are designed to be repetitive so that you understand clearly. She wants you to succeed. She is the most adorable Argentine woman ever, amazing fashion.
this class is a joke so sooooo easy
Topic seemed very interested; she was hard to understand and wasn't that helpful. Very nice person though.

worst professor ever.  i have no idea what she's saying and she has the worst writing ever, so the overheads are of no use.  Really tough tests that are graded by the TA (this semester is Mian Zhu- good TA but a brutally grader)-40% of the class is getting below a C average after the first two midterms.  Avoid this class.

She is disorganized, never on schedule, and wastes most of class time by writing everything on the board.  However, I couldn't help but find the subject matter interesting, and she is willing to give you help if you need it.  Take 474 or 364 instead of this class.

I disagree with other responders. 1. She doesn't speak english 2. She doesn't speak any language fluently (Are you SpanisH?) 3. She doesn't understand the content. Take another class, you have options.

Great Professor.  Would definitely take another class with her.  Tests are tough, but fair.  She supplies a lot of online materials which help clarify what she does in class.  If you put the time in you will do fine in this class.
Good interseting class.  Read materials for second exam
No Comments
